thread.title: Chris Smalling urges Zlatan Ibrahimovic to stay | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Chris Smalling urges Zlatan Ibrahimovic to stay | Daily Mail Online

author: Spencer Morgan For Mailonline
title: Chris Smalling urges Zlatan Ibrahimovic to stay | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Manchester United defender Chris Smalling is hoping team-mate Zlatan Ibrahimovic will still be at Old Trafford next season. The Swedish striker is yet to confirm where his future lies, with his current contract holding the option for a second term. And the 35-year-old has excelled expectations so far this term, scoring 23 goals in 35 appearances, leading United fans to call for the iconic forward to stay for another campaign. Chris Smalling (centre) congratulates Zlatan Ibrahimovic after his first goal on Thursday Ibrahimovic has excelled expectations, scoring 23 goals in 35 appearances so far this season And England international Smalling insists the entire dressing room is willing Ibrahimovic to do just that. 'I would definitely like to see Zlatan stay here,' he told the Sunday People, 'because you can see how he has performed this year and the goals he has scored. 'If we can keep a player like that for as long as we can then all the players would be very happy with that. RELATED ARTICLES
